alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 12:28PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bayfield, northwestern Iron, Ashland and northeastern Sawyer Counties through 100 PM CDT... At 1227 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ashland, to near Sanborn, to Cable, moving southeast at 40 mph. At 1220 PM CDT the Ashland Airport observation site gusted to 36 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ashland and Sanborn around 1230 PM CDT. Marengo and Odanah around 1235 PM CDT. Namekagon Lake around 1240 PM CDT. Mellen and Namekagon around 1245 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Gurney, Saxon, Clam Lake and Upson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
